title: Mount Lodge (Yakutat)
text: Mount Lodge, also named Boundary Peak 166, is a mountain in <a href="Alaska">Alaska</a> and <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>, located on the <a href="Canada%E2%80%93United%20States%20border">Canada–United States border</a>, and part of the <a href="Fairweather%20Range">Fairweather Range</a> of the <a href="Saint%20Elias%20Mountains">Saint Elias Mountains</a>. It was named in 1908 for Senator <a href="Henry%20Cabot%20Lodge">Henry Cabot Lodge</a>, (1850-1924), <a href="U.S.%20Boundary%20Commissioner">U.S. Boundary Commissioner</a> in 1903.
